prayer: Ask God to help you be thankful at all times.
challenge: Work on any areas of your life where you lack thankfulness.
title: Attitude of gratitude
quoteContent: The best way to show my gratitude to God is to accept everything, even my problems, with joy
thought:
Talk about times when you have been in conflict with others.

Paul praises God for the Corinthian church. How must you talk about and treat other churches?

Why should you be thankful amid chaos, misery and trials?

When was the last time you heard some amazing news?

How did the people respond to John’s message? 

Why did John think he was not worthy to untie Jesus’ sandals?
challenge: Read Deuteronomy 31: 6 and Isaiah 41: 13 each day this week.
prayer: Ask God for more confidence to share your faith with others.
title: Great news!
quoteContent: The gospel is only good news when we understand the bad news

thought:
What do you think the word ‘anointed’ means?

What are the different things God anointed Isaiah to do? 

Read Luke 4: 14-21. How did Jesus live out his anointing?
title: Anointed?
quoteContent: Don’t wait to be anointed. Act as if
challenge: Think about how you can be good news to the world around you.
prayer: Thank God for the good news and ask God to anoint you afresh.
Ask God to help you when you struggle to believe in him.
title: Holy Gift
quoteContent: The birth of Jesus is the sunrise in the Bible
thought:
What news have you received that you found hard to believe? 

Why do you think God used an angel to tell Mary and not a human?

Is there anything in this reading that you find extra-ordinary?
challenge: Be more open to God speaking to you in extra-ordinary ways.
Praise someone who does something really well this week.
quoteContent: The praise that comes from love does not make us vain, but more humble
title: Praise God
prayer: Thank God for creation and the things you most praise God for.
thought:
What do you think the word ‘praise’ means in this reading? 

Has anyone ever given you praise for something you have done?

What five things would you most praise the Lord for?

quoteContent: Nothing can dim the light which shines from within
challenge: Light a candle and take time reflecting on Jesus, Light of the world.
title: Light of the world
prayer: Ask God to help you shine Jesus brightly in your life.
thought:
Why don’t people recognise Jesus today?

Why is Jesus ‘becoming flesh’ (v.14) so important?

How is Jesus the light of your life?

title: Inside Out
challenge: Think of one part of your life that needs transforming and pray about it.
prayer: Ask God to fill you with his Holy Spirit.
thought:
What do you know about baptism?

Baptism is about being transformed. In what ways can Christians be transformed?

How can the Holy Spirit transform you?
quoteContent: Live to seek to draw close to God in all ways and seek his transforming love

thought:
What skills are needed to be a good listener?

Imagine you are Samuel. How would you have reacted to the voice?

How do Christians hear God’s voice today?
prayer: Pause, be quiet and reflect on Psalm 46: 10 – ‘Be still and know that I am God.’
challenge: How many ways will God speak to you this week? You might be surprised!
title: Are you listening?
quoteContent: If you do all the talking when you pray, how will you ever hear God's answers?

prayer: Thank God that he blesses those who are obedient to him.
title: Blessings
challenge: Make it a priority to spend time reading scriptures - start with John 14: 23
quoteContent: Blessings sometimes show up in unrecognizable disguises
thought:
What does ‘obedience’ mean?

Read Psalm 128: 1. How does God reward those who are obedient to him?

When was the last time you were obedient to God?

challenge: Find and read other stories about Jesus’ miracles in Mark’s gospel.
title: I know who you are
prayer: Thank Jesus that he knows who you are and wants the best for you.
thought:
How do you know if someone is telling the truth?

Why do you think the evil spirit spoke to Jesus in this way?

How does Jesus’ authority over the evil spirit make you feel?
quoteContent: The truth isn't always beauty, but the hunger for it is
I have so many things to do today, I dare not ignore my time with God
prayer: God is always available. Ask God to help you make time for him.
challenge: This week, start each day with a ‘quiet time’ in prayer and reading your Bible.
title: Time with God
thought:
Where is your favourite place to escape to?

Why do you think Jesus got up early to pray on his own?

How does starting the day with prayer make a difference?

What can you think of that transforms into something different?

If you had been there with Jesus, how would you have felt? 

Why do you think Jesus told his friends to keep quiet about what they saw?
challenge: Read Romans 12: 2 each day this week.
title: Be transformed
quoteContent: Personal transformation can and does have global effects
prayer: Ask God to help you transform the lives of others.

thought:
Can you draw or describe ten different road signs? 

Why do you think God made a new promise with Noah and his family?

How has God given you help, encouragement or direction?
challenge: Look out for road signs and remember God’s promises.
quoteContent: It is easy to make promises - it is hard work to keep them
prayer: Pray that God reveals more about his promises to you.
title: A promise is a promise

quoteContent: Once you have commitment, you need the discipline and hard work to get you there
prayer: Ask God to help you wholeheartedly follow Jesus.
thought:
What can’t you live without, even for just a few hours?

What does it mean to deny yourself?

What does it mean to take up your cross and follow Jesus?
title: All in for Jesus
challenge: Try having a screen free day this week to spend time with God.

title: Rules over all
thought:
There is a saying: ‘Rules are made to be broken.’ So what is the point of rules?

Look up Matthew 22: 36-40. What is the most important commandment to Jesus?

How difficult is it to love God with all your heart, soul and mind?
prayer: Thank God that his rules help us enter into relationship with him.
quoteContent: You don't win a game by hitting the ball out of the court
challenge: Find creative ways to love your neighbours this week.

thought:
Can you think of someone who has shown grace and mercy?

What does Paul mean when he says ‘by grace you have been saved’?

How does ‘God’s great love for us’ make a difference to your life?
challenge: Think about how you respond to God’s love and share it with others.
prayer: Praise God for his unconditional love for you.
title: Riches of his grace
quoteContent: An acronym for grace is God’s riches at Christ’s expense

prayer: Thank God for his unfailing love for us and for others.
quoteContent: Fear is the glue that keeps you stuck. Faith is the solvent that sets you free
challenge: Think before you do something wrong and do something right instead.
thought:
‘Sin’ is another word for ‘wrong’. When have you done something wrong? 

Why does God keep washing away the sins of people who do wrong?

If God forgives us, why do we find it hard to forgive others?
title: Washed away

prayer: Ask God to help you put others before yourself.
challenge: Do something for another person, expecting nothing in return.
title: The ultimate example
quoteContent: Faith never knows where it is being led, but it loves and knows the One who is leading
thought:
When have you looked out for others?

What does Paul tell us about who Jesus is?

Why does God want us to put others before ourselves?

prayer: Thank God for sending Jesus to earth to die for you!
title: There is hope
challenge: Recommit your life to Jesus using the words from Jeremiah 29: 11.
thought:
What do you think is the most significant event in the entire Bible?

How did Jesus’ resurrection change his first disciples?

How could you follow Jesus with that same boldness and faith?
quoteContent: : Hope is being able to see that there is light despite all the darkness
This only serves to confirm my suspicions, that I’m still a man in need of a Saviour
title: In the light
prayer: Use verse 5 as you pray: ‘God is light, there is no darkness in him at all.’
thought:
Would you rather a walk on a summer’s day or on a dark night? 

What advantages does the writer say there are to living in ‘the light’?

How can the light of Jesus change the whole world?
challenge: Ask God to shine his light on each area of your life and receive his forgiveness.

title: When in doubt
quoteContent: Doubt kills more dreams than failure ever will
prayer: Pray that in times of doubt, God draws close to you.
challenge: Ask someone if they think Jesus rose from the dead and share what you believe.
thought:
When have you doubted something? 

How would you feel if Jesus stood here right now? What would you say?

How would you explain Jesus rising from the dead in five words?

challenge: Read and reflect on Psalm 23.
title: The good shepherd
quoteContent: You don't learn to walk by following rules. You learn by doing, and by falling over
thought:
What do you know about sheep and the way they behave? 

Why is it important for sheep to know the voice of their shepherd?

What does Jesus mean when he says ‘I am the gate’?
prayer: Ask God to help you recognise his voice.

quoteContent: Tell the story of the mountain you climbed. Your words could become a page in someone else’s survival guide
thought:
When have you helped someone understand something about Jesus? 

How did Philip share Jesus’ love with the Ethiopian? 

What can you learn from Philip and the way God used him to speak to the Ethiopian?
title: Divine encounter
prayer: Ask the Holy Spirit to prompt you to share Jesus this week.
challenge: Pray for your friends who don’t know Jesus.

thought:
Do you find it easy or hard to praise God?

Psalm 98 is full of praise. What verses do you particularly like?

How can this psalm encourage you to praise God?
prayer: List all the things you are thankful for and pray for each one.
challenge: Rewrite Psalm 98 as your own song of praise to God.
title: Sing a new song
quoteContent: When I worship I would rather my heart be without words than my words be without heart

title: Power of prayer
prayer: Listen instead of asking God for something.
quoteContent: Prayer does not change God, but it changes him who prays
challenge: Prayer is the powerful gift of talking to the most powerful God. Use it!
thought:
When you pray, are you usually thinking more about yourself or about God?

Do you believe that prayer is powerful? Why or why not?

How can you make the power of prayer a part of your daily life?

prayer: Sit quietly in prayer and ask to receive the Holy Spirit.
title: I will pour out my Spirit
quoteContent: To serve God, to love God, to enjoy God, is the sweetest freedom in the world
thought:
Can you think of a time when you’ve seen the Holy Spirit at work?

Who does the reading say the Spirit is poured out upon? 

In what ways can the Holy Spirit help you to love and serve God?
challenge: Each day ask God to fill you with his Holy Spirit as you serve him.

prayer: Thank God that he loved the world so much he sent Jesus.
challenge: Memorise Jesus’ words in John 3: 16-17.
title: Born again
quoteContent: Once a man is united to God, how could he not live forever?
thought:
Why do you think Nicodemus came to see Jesus after dark?

What do you think Jesus means when he says ‘you must be born again’?

How would you explain John 3: 16-17 in your own words?

What have you done wrong that you found hard to own up to? 

How did God punish the man and his wife? What would you have done?

Is following God about rules or about being in a relationship with him?
challenge: Be prepared to own up when you make mistakes.
prayer: Pray that your relationship with God grows more each day.
title: Owning up
quoteContent: False words are not only evil in themselves, but they infect the soul with evil

title: Hidden Potential
prayer: Pray that God uses the small things in your life to affect others.
challenge: Plant some mustard seeds and watch them grow.
thought:
What are the smallest and largest things you own? 

Who has helped you understand what it means to be a Christian?

What can you tell a friend that will help them understand more about God?
quoteContent: Potential means nothing if you don’t do anything with it

challenge: Read Psalm 46 and highlight the words of comfort.
thought:
What are your greatest fears?

What does this story teach you about Jesus?

What would it take to fully rely on Jesus?
quoteContent: Storms make trees take deeper roots
prayer: Ask God to calm the things that feel out of control in your life
title: Calm in the storm

prayer: Ask God to help you remember his faithfulness.
quoteContent: How else but through a broken heart may Lord Christ enter in?
challenge: Read verses 22 and 23 every morning this week.
title: Faithful God
thought:
What challenging times have you experienced?

Which verse speaks most powerfully to you? Why?

What difference does it make knowing that God is compassionate and faithful?

challenge: Search for ‘Strength Bible verses’ online and highlight your favourites in your Bible.
prayer: Remember, ‘I can do all things through him who strengthens me’ (Philippians 4: 13).
title: Weak made strong
quoteContent: Every flower must grow through dirt
thought:
Have you ever felt weak or feeble? How did that make you feel?

Why do you think Paul delighted in his own weakness?

Why does God give strength to those who believe and trust in him?

challenge: The gospel is Good News! Don’t be ashamed to be a follower of Jesus.
thought:
Why did King David dance before the Lord with all his might? (v.20-21)

Why might some Christians feel ashamed of what they believe?

What gives you confidence? What is it like to find confidence in God?
quoteContent: A gentleman would be ashamed should his deeds not match his words
prayer: Pray for the situations when you felt ashamed and embarrassed
title: Unashamed

thought:
When have you felt compassion for others?

How do you think the disciples reacted when they saw the crowd? 

What does Jesus’ response teach you about how you should respond to others?
quoteContent: I have this theory that if one person can go out of their way to show compassion, it could start a chain reaction
challenge: Think of three ways that you can show compassion to others.
title: Compassion
prayer: Ask God to help you to be more compassionate.
Thank God that he accepts the little we offer and uses it in amazing ways.
title: What can I give?
quoteContent: It's not how much we give but how much love we put into giving
thought:
Have you ever done something simple that made a big difference?

Which part of this story is most surprising to you?

What does the story teach you about giving and trusting?
challenge: Ask God to use your gift in a miraculous way!

quoteContent: Food for the body is not enough. There must be food for the soul
prayer: Ask God to give you his daily bread so you can grow as a Christian.
title: I am the bread of life
thought:
What is your favourite food and why? 

Jesus calls himself the ‘bread of life’. What do you think this means?

How can you feed your faith so it keeps growing?
challenge: Prepare some food for someone else.

quoteContent: Let God's promises shine on your problems
prayer: Pray that God will draw close to those you know who are troubled or afraid.
challenge: Read Psalm 34: 4-8 each day this week.
title: Troubled times
thought:
Who do you turn to when you feel scared or troubled? 

What stories have you heard about how God has helped others in trouble?

In what ways has God helped you in your life?

If you could ask God for anything, what would you ask for?

What do you think about Solomon’s choice and God’s response?

What is the difference between being intelligent and being wise?
title: True wisdom
prayer: Ask God to help you make wise choices.
challenge: Look at the book of Proverbs. Write down some wise words.
quoteContent: Knowledge with wisdom is like water in the sand
When God closes a door, he always opens a window
challenge: Write down the pieces of armour and a way you can use each in your daily life.
thought:
Have you ever been in a spiritual battle? How did it feel?

In the reading, which piece of armour stood out to you most and why?

Which piece of armour do you often neglect?
prayer: Ask God to help you put on his armour each day.
title: Dress well

quoteContent: As long as you do things for God, you are a Hall of Famer in heaven's list
prayer: Ask God for a deeper desire to read and study the Bible.
thought:
Why do teachers tell students to study for their exams? 

Why are Christians encouraged to read God’s word every day?

How does knowing the Bible help you to become a better Christian?
challenge: Live by example this week and reveal God’s compassion and love to others.
title: Living out the word

quoteContent: Only those who are aware of God's wrath are amazed by God's grace
title: The deep sigh
thought:
A sigh expresses sorrow, relief or exhaustion. Is sighing a bad thing?

Read verse 34. Why do you think Jesus gave out a deep sigh?

Do you think God ever gets weary of loving you?
challenge: Look up Lamentations 3: 22 - God’s love never ends! His mercies never cease.
prayer: Thank God that he loves you unconditionally.

title: Taming the tongue
thought:
Can you think of something embarrassing you said, that you regretted? 

How does James describe the tongue and the power of speech?

How do you think God wants us to speak to one another?
challenge: Think about how you use words to bless others in person or online.
prayer: Ask God to forgive you when you have hurt others with your words.
quoteContent: Gossip is the Devil's radio

challenge: Put others first this week!
prayer: Ask God to help you understand what it means to be his servant.
thought:
Would you rather be a celebrity or an unknown world changer?

Why were the disciples silent when Jesus asked what they were discussing?

What does it mean to be first in God’s kingdom?
quoteContent: Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world
title: Last shall be first

challenge: Help someone who is having a tough time.
title: Stumbling blocks
quoteContent: Focus on giants, you stumble. Focus on God, giants tumble
prayer: Pray for God’s help in the things you struggle with.
thought:
What are the current stumbling blocks in your life?

This reading uses strong language. How would you explain it to others?

How can you prevent yourself from stumbling in your walk with Jesus?

challenge: Find someone to mentor you in your faith.
quoteContent: It is easy to look down on others; to look down on ourselves is the difficulty
thought:
Who are the key people who help you grow in your faith?

What actions and attitudes distinguish a person of God? 

What does it mean to walk in faithfulness?
title: Heart examination
prayer: Ask God to help you be a more faithful person.
Ask God to draw near to you in challenging times.
thought:
Have you ever felt abandoned by God?

How do you think David felt when he wrote these words?

How could these verses provide comfort for you during challenging times?
challenge: Go to a special place and write a list of all the truths you know about God.
quoteContent: If you feel far from God right now, guess who moved? You’re only a decision away from reconnecting
title: Where are you God?

thought:
When was the last time you asked for something important?

How do you think James and John reacted to Jesus’ answer to their request (v.37)?

Is it OK to request things from God? Will God answer as requested?
title: What are you asking?
challenge: Be bold in faith and ask God for something important in your life.
quoteContent: It is not fair to ask of others what you are not willing to do yourself
prayer: Ask God to help you put others above yourself this week.

challenge: Seize the moment and ask God to heal someone you know.
quoteContent: The future depends on what you do today
title: Seizing the moment
prayer: Invite God to reveal himself to you when you least expect it.
thought:
When have you called out to Jesus in a time of need?

What emotions does Bartimaeus experience as the story unfolds?

Why was Bartimaeus insistent on calling out to Jesus? Was it worth it?

prayer: Use Psalm 103 as inspiration for your prayers of praise and thanks.
challenge: Put some Bible verses in places where you and your family will see them.
quoteContent: Only in prayer can we learn to love God with all our heart, mind and soul
title: Love the Lord your God
thought:
What three things are most important to teach children?

Why does Moses tell the people they must obey God’s commands?

How can we help one another to love God with all our heart, soul and strength?

Can you think of a time when you changed your mind about something?

What was different the second time God asked Jonah to go to Nineveh?

Is this kind of change possible in a large city today?
challenge: Go for a walk and ask God for positive change in the place where you live.
prayer: Pray that more people in your city, town or village will come to know God.
title: Change of heart
quoteContent: Believe the best about people. Pray for their shortcomings. You are not the standard. We all need grace

prayer: Pray that humans do all they can to look after God’s world.
title: Finishing line
quoteContent: I don’t know what my future holds, but I do know who holds my future
challenge: Do something practical to show you care for God’s world.
thought:
What is the most amazing building you have ever seen?

There are lots of troubles in the world. Which one concerns you most?

One day God will ‘make all things new’. What do you want to see made new?

title: Alpha and Omega
thought:
Revelation is the last book in the Bible. What are your favourite books?

What have you started to do and struggled to finish?

What do you think ‘who is, and who was, and who is to come’ means?
challenge: Keep going when you find things hard.
prayer: Thank God that he is interested in you and all you do.
quoteContent: Life is God’s novel. Let him write it

prayer: Ask God to help you be ready for his return.
quoteContent: The simple act of paying attention can take you a long way.
challenge: Spend five minutes each day listening to God.
title: Be Alert
thought:
When have you had to be alert?

What does this reading say about being alert?

How can you get ready for Christ’s return?

quoteContent: I’m an imperfect messenger but the message is perfect.
thought:
Have you received an amazing message? What did it say?

Why does Malachi describe God’s messenger as fire and soap (v.3)?

How would you describe ‘the messenger’ to a non-Christian?
prayer: Thank God for all the prophets who foretold the birth of Jesus.
challenge: Send an amazing message of blessing to a friend today.
title: The Messenger

thought:
What do you worry about most? 

How might praying instead of worrying help?

Can you think of a time when you experienced the peace of God?
title: Don't worry, pray
challenge: Start each day by bringing your worries to God in prayer.
quoteContent: Prayer doesn’t bend God’s arm but it’s guaranteed to bend our hearts toward His will. Worry less. Pray more.
prayer: Pray that God’s peace would guard the hearts and minds of those who are anxious.
Thank God for all the good things in your life.
challenge: Go for a walk and silently thank God for the things you see.
thought:
What are you most thankful for?

What is Mary thanking God for in the reading?

Do you think God is ever thankful to humans? Why?
title: Thanks be to God
quoteContent: We give thanks to God not because of how we feel but because of who He is.

prayer: Thank God for his creation.
challenge: Do something this week that helps to look after creation.
title: Praise where praise is due
thought:
When have you received praise for doing something?

What words or phrases could replace ‘praise’ in the psalm?

What would you praise God for today?
quoteContent: The sweetest of all sounds is praise.

title: Words
prayer: Ask Jesus to be light in your life.
quoteContent: We realise the importance of our voices only when we are silenced.
thought:
Why are words and symbols important?

Who is ‘the Word’ John is referring to?

How has ‘the Word’ brought light to your life?
challenge: Memorise John 1: 1.

title: Baptism
prayer: Invite the Holy Spirit to fill you.
quoteContent: Baptism is the initial step of a faithful heart.
challenge: Ask some people about their experience of baptism.
thought:
Why do you think baptism is important?

What would it have felt like to be at Jesus’ baptism?

Why do you think God chose to speak out loud at that moment?

quoteContent: You can’t buy love, because when it’s real, it’s priceless.
challenge: Write a letter to God expressing how you feel about his love.
thought:
What is precious to you; what do you consider irreplaceable?

How does the psalmist describe God’s love in verse 7?

Why is love so important to God?
title: Unwavering Love
prayer: Pray for people you know who need to feel God’s love today.

quoteContent: Amen is not the end of a prayer, it just gets us ready to go to the next level.
thought:
Why do Christians say ‘Amen’ at the end of prayers? 

When was the last time you agreed with something someone said?

Why did the crowd feel compelled to say ‘Amen!’ twice in verse 6?
prayer: Thank God that the joy of the Lord is your strength (v.10).
title: Amen, Amen!
challenge: End your prayers this week saying ‘Amen’ twice. Take a deep breath between Amens.

prayer: Thank God that his love never fails.
quoteContent: Where there is love there is life.
challenge: Read 1 Corinthians 13: 4-7 each day this week.
title: Love never gives up
thought:
What in the world do you love most?

Which word or phrase stands out to you in this passage?

What can you learn from these definitions of love?

challenge: Be a messenger of God’s good news this week.
thought:
What is the strangest message you have been asked to deliver?

Why was the hot coal important in Isaiah’s vision?

What message might God be asking you to deliver?
prayer: Pray the prayer: ‘Here I am Lord. Send me.’
title: Send me
quoteContent: God isn’t looking for people of great faith, but for individuals ready to follow Him.

thought:
What is the difference between a blessing and a curse?

What does the reading say about how you can receive God’s blessing?

Do blessings only come from God?
prayer: Thank God for the blessings in your life.
challenge: Ask God to bless someone who really needs a blessing.
title: Curse or blessing
quoteContent: It is through exchange that difference becomes a blessing, not a curse.

title: Stay calm
quoteContent: Life isn't about waiting for the storm to pass... It's about learning to dance in the rain.
challenge: Tell a friend going through a hard time that you are praying for them.
thought:
What is the worst weather you have experienced?

If you had been in the boat, what would you have done?

When have you experienced God in a crisis?
prayer: Ask God to draw close to those you know who are in difficulty.
Ask God to reveal himself to you.
title: God's light shines
thought:
Have you met someone whose faith stands out? How were they different?

Read 2 Corinthians 3: 7 & 13. Why did Moses put the veil over his face?

Do you ever see this sort of shining in people’s faces today?
quoteContent: Don't shine so others can see you. Shine so that through you, others can see Him.
challenge: Pray that God will reveal himself to one of your non-Christian friends.

quoteContent: Never give up on your dream… you never know what the Lord can bless you with.
thought:
How do you feel when you give in to temptation?
 
Read James 1: 2-3. Does God ever test us?

How does Jesus tell his followers to deal with temptation? Read Matthew 26: 41.
challenge: Next time you feel tempted write a helpful message to yourself.
prayer: Ask God to help you in times of temptation - he will provide a way out.
title: Giving in
Confidence in God
prayer: Spend a few minutes resting in God’s presence; receive his love and protection.
quoteContent: The future is as bright as the promises of God.
challenge: Try writing your own psalm to remind you of God’s promises.
thought:
What or who gives you confidence?

As you read the psalm, did any phrase stand out for you?

How can you have greater confidence in God?

title: You are always there for me
quoteContent: Whenever you want to see me, always look at the sunset; I will be there.
challenge: Draw alongside someone who is alone.
prayer: Pray for people who are lonely, isolated or scared.
thought:
Who is always there when you need them?

Do you think God is always there for you? How?


Is God only available for believers or for everyone?

prayer: Thank God that he never leaves or abandons us.
quoteContent: Not all those who wander are lost.
challenge: List the characteristics of God that you love most.
title: Wandering
thought:
What are the qualities of a good father?

Which son wandered the furthest from his father? Why?

What does this story tell you about God?

What are your favourite smells?

How do you think Lazarus, Martha and the other disciples reacted to Mary’s actions?

Why were Mary’s actions so significant to Jesus?
title: Scent from heaven
challenge: Be bold in faith and bless someone with a generous gift.
quoteContent: Nothing brings to life again a forgotten memory like fragrance.
prayer: Ask the Holy Spirit to help you be more obedient to God.

thought:
Why is Good Friday called Good Friday?
              
How do you think Jesus’ friends felt as they watched him facing death?

Could Jesus have stopped this happening?
quoteContent: God proved His love on the Cross. When Christ hung, and bled, and died, it was God saying to the world, ‘I love you.’
title: Crucified
challenge: Read the whole Easter story this week (Luke chapters 22-24).
prayer: Thank Jesus for going to the cross for you.
Pray for those who are trying to make the world a better place.
thought:
If you created a new world, what would it look like?

How does the reading describe a new heaven and earth?

What would make the world a better place today?
quoteContent: New day, new hopes, new life.
challenge: Do something this week that expresses God’s love to others.
title: A new day will dawn

thought:
When was the last time you had doubts?

How do you think Thomas felt when he saw and touched Jesus?

What does the truth of Jesus’ resurrection mean for you?
prayer: Thank God that Jesus rose from the dead.
challenge: When you have doubts ask God to reassure you.
title: Doubting Thomas
quoteContent: I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else.

challenge: Share your story of knowing Jesus with a non-Christian this week.
title: Transformation
prayer: Praise God that he transforms lives!
quoteContent: We delight in the beauty of the butterfly, but rarely admit the changes it has gone through to achieve that beauty.
thought:
Who do you know who has been changed through meeting Jesus?

How do you think Ananias felt when God asked him to visit Saul?

How do you think people responded to the transformed Saul?

challenge: Read Matthew 10: 1.
prayer: Thank God that you can receive his amazing power!
thought:
Have you heard of someone being involved in a miracle?
 
How do you think Peter was feeling as he entered the room with Tabitha’s body?

Do you believe that you have the power to heal?
quoteContent: You have to see the miracles for there to be miracles.
title: Get up!

quoteContent: Don’t tell God how big your storm is. Tell the storm how big your God is.
challenge: Rewrite today’s ‘revelation’ (21: 1-6) in your own words.
thought:
What is the oldest thing your family owns?

Why would God call himself ‘the Alpha and the Omega’?

How do you feel about ‘the new heaven and earth’ described in verses 5-8?
title: Alpha and Omega
prayer: Pray for God’s Kingdom to come and his will be done, on earth as it is in heaven.

quoteContent: Miracles are not contrary to nature but only contrary to what we know about nature.
title: Miracle healing
thought:
How would you describe a miracle?

Why did Jesus ask the man if he wanted to get well?

What does the story teach you about healing?
challenge: Look up another healing story in the Bible.
prayer: Pray for someone you know who is living with a disability.

thought:
If you were a song, what song would you be?

What is most surprising to you about this story?

How can focusing on praise help you in tough situations?
prayer: Pray for those who are imprisoned for their faith.
quoteContent: We can always find a reason to praise. Situations change for better and for worse, but God's worth never changes.
title: Midnight praise
challenge: Memorise a song of praise you can sing when things are tough.

quoteContent: There is nothing strange when you come to know it.
prayer: Ask God to pour out his Holy Spirit in the world today.
challenge: Look out for the Holy Spirit at work this week.
title: Strange happenings
thought:
What is the strangest thing you have ever seen?

What does this reading say about the Holy Spirit?

How do you see the Holy Spirit at work today?

What do you hope for?

What is the difference between hoping and wishing?

What does the reading say about hope in God?
title: Hope springs eternal
prayer: Ask God to bring hope to those who are in need.
quoteContent: Hope is being able to see that there is light despite all the darkness.
challenge: Write a message of hope and put it in a window where people can see it.

prayer: Thank God that his voice can be heard in different ways.
quoteContent: Before you speak, it is necessary for you to listen, for God speaks in the silence of the heart.
title: God in the silence
thought:
When was the last time you sensed God was speaking to you?

How do you think Elijah felt when God whispered to him?

How does God speak to people today?
challenge: Listen to a worship song and invite God to speak to you.

quoteContent: Create your legacy, and pass the baton.
title: Pass the baton
prayer: Ask God to be with you as you experience change in your life.
challenge: Support someone who is experiencing change.
thought:
How do you feel when familiar things change?

Why did Elisha ask for a ‘double portion’ of Elijah’s spirit?

How do you think Elisha felt about taking on the baton from Elijah?

quoteContent: If God tells you to do something, do it. If God tells you to go, you go!
title: Harvest is plentiful
challenge: Research and pray for persecuted Christians who stand up for their faith.
prayer: Thank God for those who share their faith in strange new places.
thought:
Why did Jesus send the disciples into towns ahead of him?

What were the disciples feeling, entering a strange new town without Jesus?

Why do you think Jesus said, ‘I am sending you out like lambs among wolves’ (v.3)?

title: Obey the Lord
prayer: Ask the Holy Spirit to help you be more obedient to God.
quoteContent: Obedience is the fruit of faith.
thought:
Do you find it easy or hard to obey God’s commands?

How do you think God feels when you get it wrong?

What comfort and hope can you take from verses 11-14?
challenge: Do something radical that is obedient to God.

title: Time with Jesus
quoteContent: I wanted to figure out why I was so busy, but I couldn't find the time to do it.
challenge: Spend two minutes of quiet each day this week to rest in Jesus’ presence.
prayer: Pray for those who struggle to spend time with God.
thought:
Would you rather be too busy or not have enough to do?

Which character do you most relate to, Martha or Mary? Why?

What does this story teach you about how to spend your time?

title: Rooted
challenge: Ask another Christian how they stay rooted in Jesus Christ.
prayer: Pray Paul’s prayer in Ephesians 3: 14-21.
thought:
Why are roots so important for plants and trees?

In verse 8, what does Paul warn us against?

What does it mean to live rooted and built up in Jesus?
quoteContent: A tree without roots is just a piece of wood.

prayer: Pray for those in desperate situations.
challenge: Offer to help someone in need this week.
quoteContent:
In every life we have some trouble
But when you worry you make it double.
Don't worry, be happy.
title: It will all be ok
thought:
What situations have you been in where you couldn’t see a way out?

What does this psalm say to those who cry out to God?

When have you cried out to God and things changed?

When you last gazed into the night sky, what did you see?

Why do you think God told Abram he would have a family outnumbering the stars?

Abram trusted what God said. How easy do you find it to trust God?
quoteContent: The stars are the landmarks of the universe.
prayer: Pray for your family; those close and those who live far away.
challenge: Gaze at the night sky and listen to what God is saying to you.
title: Counting the stars
Running the race
thought:
How do athletes prepare for a race or competition?

Why does Paul suggest that Christians follow the example of an athlete? 

How should we run the race of faith?
challenge: This week, when facing obstacles or feeling discouraged, remember Jesus.
quoteContent: We all have dreams. But in order to make dreams come into reality, it takes an awful lot of determination, dedication, self-discipline, and effort.
prayer: Ask God to equip you to run the race of faith.

challenge: Choose a friend and share how important God is to you.
quoteContent: God will meet you where you are... in order to take you where He wants you to go.
title: Rescuer
prayer: Pray Psalm 71: 1-6.
thought:
Right now, how close do you feel to God? Why?

Why does the writer of this psalm ask God to be his ‘rock of refuge’ (v.3)?

What would you like your friends to know about God?

title: Gift of giving
thought:
Think of the last gift you gave to someone. How did it make that person feel?

Why is it important for churches to show hospitality?

How can you be more generous and hospitable to others?
quoteContent: People will forget what you said, forget what you did, but people will never forget how you made them feel.
challenge: Find a way of showing hospitality to someone this week.
prayer: Pray that God helps you show hospitality to those most in need.

challenge: Rewrite Joshua 1: 9 in your own words and use it as a bookmark.
prayer: Ask God to help you be a better follower of Jesus Christ.
quoteContent: God doesn't believe in the easy way.
thought:
Do you think it is easy or hard being a Christian?


What is Jesus saying to his disciples in verses 27 and 33?

What can you apply from this challenging reading?
title: Easy option?

prayer: Pray that those you know who are lost, would be found in Jesus.
challenge: Write a parable about being lost and found that’s relevant today.
thought:
Have you ever lost something? Did you find it? How?

How do the two parables illustrate Jesus’ point?

Why do you think Jesus used parables when he spoke?
quoteContent: I once was lost but now I’m found, was blind but now I see.
title: Lost and found

quoteContent: Things happen which would not happen without prayer. Let us not forget that.
title: Let us pray
challenge: Make a list of leaders you can pray for this week.
thought:
When and where do you pray?

How does Paul say people should focus their prayers?
 
How can you pray for those in authority?
prayer: Pray for those who lead, both nationally and locally.

title: The love of money
prayer: Ask God for a healthy perspective on money and how to use it wisely.
challenge: Consider a charity or good cause you might want to support with money or time.
quoteContent: A wise person should have money in their head, but not in their heart.
thought:
What is the most expensive thing you own?

Is it right to want nice things? Why?

What is the warning in this reading?

What does ‘humility’ mean?

What is the difference between a master and a servant?

How can you be a faithful servant who trusts your Master?
quoteContent: Faith is only real when there is obedience, never without it, and faith only becomes faith in the act of obedience.
title: Faith or obedience?
prayer: Ask God to help you be a faithful follower.
challenge: Secretly do an act of kindness this week.

thought:
What five things are you most thankful for?

Why did only one leper thank Jesus?

How can you be more thankful?
title: Say thank you!
prayer: Spend a few minutes saying prayers of thanks.
challenge: Find a creative way to say thank you to someone this week.
quoteContent: Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough.

title: Dwell in the word
thought:
Why is it important for Christians to read the Bible regularly?

How does meditating on God’s law help the psalmist?

What are the similarities between this passage and 2 Timothy 3: 16?
prayer: Ask God to ignite a passion for reading and dwelling in his word.
quoteContent: Words have the power to make things happen.
challenge: Choose an unfamiliar book of the Bible and read it.
Write encouraging scriptures on sticky notes and place them around the house.
title: God knows
prayer: Pray the tax collector’s prayer: ‘God, have mercy on me, a sinner.’
thought:
What are the differences between the two main characters in this reading?

Why was the tax collector the only one forgiven by God in the parable?

What can you learn from the behaviour of the Pharisee?
quoteContent: God knows what you’ve been doing. You may fool me but you can’t fool God.

thought:
What makes something right?

Why is God telling the people to stop bringing their offerings?

In what ways can worship be meaningless to God?
prayer: Ask God to help you act justly, love mercy and walk humbly with him (Micah 6: 8).
title: Seek justice
challenge: Find opportunities to seek justice in everyday situations this week.
quoteContent: Delight is God’s ‘why’ behind the justice, righteousness, and steadfast love He practices.

prayer: Pray that those facing difficulties might turn to God in prayer.
quoteContent: This world may push, may pull, but Your mercy never fails.
challenge: Offer to pray for someone this week.
title: Hear my prayer
thought:
Who do you call on when you’re in trouble?

How does David approach God in his prayer?

How can you be sure that God hears prayers?

title: Sing a new song
challenge: Write a poem or song offering thanks to God.
prayer: Thank God for music and songs that bring joy to others.
quoteContent: The only thing better than singing is more singing.
thought:
What is your favourite song?

What does the psalm say about God?

If you were writing a song to God what would the first line say?

challenge: Find a quiet space and reflect on ‘Be still and know that I am God.’
prayer: Pray for a situation in the world that needs God’s help.
thought:
What is the biggest challenge you have ever faced?

What does ‘Be still and know that I am God’ mean to you?

When have you felt closest to God?
title: You are not alone
quoteContent: God has promised that whatever you face, you are not alone.
If we want to realise our dreams, we have to stay awake
challenge: Look up and read the story of Christ’s birth in the Gospels.
title: Stay Awake
prayer: Pray that Advent is the time you rediscover Christ’s love for you.
thought:
Have you experienced an emergency that disrupted your daily routine?

Why does Jesus use a story about a thief to teach about being ready?

What helps you be a more alert and equipped follower of Jesus?

List examples of when you were not ready for something. 

What is the reading saying to you about being ready?

How can you make sure that you are ready to meet with Jesus?
challenge: Pray each morning for God’s help as you prepare for the day ahead.
quoteContent: To be prepared is half the victory
prayer: Pray God helps you to be ready for any big decisions you are facing.
title: Be Prepared!

prayer: Ask God to give you patience with those you find difficult.
title: Be Patient
challenge: Choose to go last in something to practice patience!
thought:
What is the most challenging thing you have had to wait for? Were you patient?

The reading mentions farmers. How and why do farmers have to be patient?

How can you stand firm as Christians await the coming of Jesus?
quoteContent: I am extraordinarily patient, provided I get my own way in the end

challenge: This week tell someone that God is with them.
quoteContent: The best thing of all is God is with us
prayer: Thank God for his promise to be with you always.
title: God with us
thought:
Can you think of a time when you knew someone was with you?

What is Isaiah speaking about in his prophecy?

Immanuel means ‘God with us’. How do you know that God is with you?

title: Dreams come true
thought:
Have you ever had a memorable dream?

Why do you think Herod acted like he did?

List the different ways God speaks to people
prayer: Invite God to speak to you in different ways.
challenge: Before you go to sleep, ask God to speak to you as you dream.
quoteContent: Life is a dream. Realise it

title: Word became flesh
quoteContent: Where would Jesus be if no one had written the gospels?
thought:
How would you describe Jesus to someone who had no idea about him? 

Why do you think the reading talks about Jesus becoming flesh?

Where else does the bible refer to Jesus being flesh and body?
challenge: Talk to someone about Jesus who doesn’t know him.
prayer: Thank God for his amazing son, Jesus.
Think of three things to say thank you to Jesus, the ‘one' who died for you.
quoteContent: Preach the Gospel at all times and when necessary use words
thought:
Have you ever witnessed something amazing?

Imagine you are a disciple. How did it feel witnessing the death and resurrection?

What does Jesus’ death and resurrection mean to you?
challenge: Read 1 Corinthians 15: 1-11 each day this week.
title: Jesus is the one!

thought:
What three things are you most thankful for?

In his letter to the Corinthians, what did Paul thank God for?

Why is it important to be thankful even when life gets challenging?
quoteContent: When you learn to say thank you, you see the world anew
title: Give thanks
challenge: Send someone a thank you message or card.
prayer: Spend ten minutes saying only thank you prayers to God.

thought:
Who do you really admire and why? 

What do you think Jesus meant when he said, ‘I will send you out to fish for people?’ 

Is it hard to follow Jesus today? Why?
quoteContent: God doesn’t call the qualified. God qualifies the called
title: The chosen ones
prayer: Ask God to help you be a better follower of Jesus.
challenge: Befriend someone outside your normal friendship group.

title: Act of kindness
challenge: Do a random act of kindness this week to bless someone else.
prayer: Pray for those who don’t have enough food or safe drinking water.
quoteContent: God will always provide. It might just look different than what we had in mind
thought:
What is your favourite food and drink? 

The widow was very poor but showed great hospitality. What would you have done?

How did God bless the widow’s kindness to Elijah?

prayer: Ask God to help you be a light in your community.
quoteContent: It’s better to be a light than to curse the darkness
thought:
Salt is a very ordinary thing but how many of its uses can you list?

What do you think Jesus is saying to his followers?

How can you and your church be salt and light in the place where you live?
title: Faith makes a difference
challenge: Make a positive impact on someone this week. Shine your light!

title: Obedience to God
thought:
What does it mean to be obedient? 

What does the Psalmist say comes from being obedient to God?

How can we encourage one another to follow in God’s ways?
quoteContent: One act of obedience is better than one hundred sermons
prayer: Read the passage again asking God to help you walk in His ways.
challenge: Listen to the song ‘May the words of my mouth’ by Tim Hughes.

title: 1st Sunday before Lent
quoteContent: Sin is not just breaking God’s laws; it is breaking His heart
prayer: Pray for the situations where you struggle to be obedient.
challenge: Next time someone asks you to do something just do it!
thought:
How do you respond when someone tells you what to do?

How did Moses show his obedience to God?

When was the last time you were obedient to God?

quoteContent: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny
title: Testing times
thought:
What does the word ‘temptation’ mean to you? 

What do you find most difficult to resist?

Jesus used scripture to resist temptation. How can the Bible help you?
prayer: Remember, ‘if you confess your sins, God is faithful and will forgive you (1 John 1:9).
challenge: Follow the example of Jesus next time you are tempted.

title: Help! I need somebody
thought:
When you need help where do you look for it? 

How does it make you feel, knowing God watches everything you do?

In what ways can you help others?
prayer: Give thanks that God is with you in every situation.
quoteContent: Sometimes it takes more courage to ask for help than to act alone
challenge: Watch out for someone who really needs help.

quoteContent: God is a spring of living water which flows unceasingly into the hearts of those who pray
thought:
When was the last time when you really desired something?

What can we learn about the Jews and Samaritans in this passage?

What is different about the living water Jesus is offering?
title: Are you thirsty?
challenge: As you use water this week ask God to quench your thirst.
prayer: Ask God to fill you with his living water.

thought:
What qualities does a shepherd need to do their job?

In what ways is Jesus like a shepherd?

How does this psalm make you feel about God’s care for you?
quoteContent: A true shepherd leads the way. He does not merely point the way
challenge: Read Psalm 23 again slowly and know God’s care for you.
title: Soul refreshment
prayer: Thank God for his amazing love and care for us.

challenge: Remember no matter how dried up and useless you may feel, God can restore you to life
thought:
Have you or someone you know ever faced an impossible task? 

God could have brought the bones to life himself. Why did he use Ezekiel?

How can God revive you in a personal situation when hope is lost?
prayer: Pray for people you know facing an ‘impossible’ life situation.
title: Mission impossible
quoteContent: Sometimes we can become oblivious to the dryness of our own soul

challenge: Put a cross in a window during holy week so everyone can see it.
prayer: Thank God that Jesus was not the king that the people expected.
title: Making an entrance
thought:
Have you ever made a grand entrance, what happened? 

Jesus made his grand entrance. How did the crowd react and why?

Why do you think we have palm crosses on Palm Sunday?
quoteContent: Hollywood is all about making an entrance. I don't want to be a walking advertisement for anyone other than myself

thought:
List different things that the world places hope in.

How would you have felt if you were at the empty tomb and then met the living Jesus?

What does Jesus’ resurrection mean to you?
title: He's alive!
quoteContent: Resurrection means that the worst thing is never the last thing
challenge: Take photos of things that remind you of new life and resurrection.
prayer: Pray the resurrection of Jesus impacts your daily life, not just at Easter.

title: Seeing is believing!
prayer: Pray for friends and family that find it hard to believe in Jesus.
thought:
What does ‘seeing is believing’ mean to you? Is this always true?

Why do you think Thomas didn’t believe the disciples’ story?

Are there times when you find it hard to believe?
quoteContent: Faith is to believe what you do not see; the reward of this faith is to see what you believe
challenge: Ask an older Christian to share their faith story with you.

thought:
If Jesus were alive today would the world recognise Him?

Why do you think God kept the disciples from recognising Jesus?

How can you help others to recognise Jesus?
challenge: Next time you are faced with a dilemma, think ‘what would Jesus do?’
quoteContent: Faith is taking the first step even when you don't see the whole staircase
prayer: Pray that God reveals himself to you when you least expect it.
title: Believing is seeing!

prayer: Ask God to help you live life to the full in Him.
title: Life to the max
thought:
Have you ever had something stolen, how did it feel? 

Why does Jesus refer to himself as the gate for the sheep?

What do you think Jesus means in John 10: 10?
challenge: Do something that you love to do that also pleases God.
quoteContent: Everything has been figured out, except how to live
God did not rescue me out of the pain. He rescued me through the pain
title: Dial 999
thought:
When have you felt really stressed? Did you wonder where God was?

What did the writer of these verses believe the Lord could do for them?

During tough times what reminds you that God is your rock and refuge?
challenge: Re-read verses 2-3 every day and memorise them word for word.
prayer: Ask God to be your rock and refuge using the words from Psalm 31: 1-5.

quoteContent: Doing good to others is not a duty. It is a joy, for it increases your own health and happiness
prayer: Pray that you keep focused on Jesus and be ready to share the hope He brings.
challenge: Look for an opportunity to share with someone the hope you have in Jesus.
title: Doing good
thought:
How easy do you find doing good things?

How does Peter encourage his readers to go about doing good? 

What is the hope we have in Jesus?

quoteContent: If we wait until we're ready, we'll be waiting for the rest of our lives
challenge: Next time you are challenged, invite the Holy Spirit to help you.
thought:
Have you ever witnessed something amazing? 

Imagine you are in the room that day. What emotions are you experiencing?

How open are you to receiving God’s gift of the Holy Spirit?
prayer: Pray that God gently reveals himself to you through His Holy Spirit.
title: Waiting for the promised gift

challenge: Ask the Holy Spirit to guide you to someone who needs prayer this week.
title: The promised gift
prayer: Quietly focus and as you breathe in say ‘Come Holy Spirit’.
thought:
What is the best gift you have received?

The Holy Spirit is a gift from God. How does Acts 2 describe this gift?

In what ways does the Holy Spirit help Christians in their daily lives?
quoteContent: The idea of waiting for something makes it more exciting

prayer: Ask God for confidence in talking to people about Jesus.
title: Passing it on
thought:
A disciple is a follower of Jesus. How do you try to follow Jesus? 

What does Jesus mean when he says, “I will be with you always”? 

In verse 19 Jesus commands his followers to ‘go’. What ways you can tell others about Jesus?
quoteContent: The church that does not evangelise will fossilise
challenge: Go and talk to someone and explain why you follow Jesus.

title: Love endured
challenge: Spend some time each day listening to worship music.
prayer: Thank God that he is good and that his love endures forever.
thought:
What things make you truly joyful?

Why is God worthy of our thanks, praise and worship?

What are the benefits of knowing God’s love endures forever? How does that make you feel?
quoteContent: The world changes – circumstances change, we change, but God’s word never changes

thought:
How does it feel when you are misunderstood?

What different emotions and feelings does Jeremiah speak about?

Can you identify with any of the things Jeremiah says?
challenge: Watch the news and pray for each situation.
title: Tough times
quoteContent: But I suppose the most revolutionary act one can engage in is to tell the truth
prayer: Pray for Christians in the world who suffer because of their faith.

quoteContent: You can drift into sin, but not into righteousness
prayer: Thank God that by His grace you have been set free from sin.
challenge: Scan through your contacts – who needs to hear that God loves them?
thought:
Why is the word ‘sin’ so important to the Christian faith?

What do you think Paul means when he says we are ‘slaves to sin’?

Read Romans 6: 11-14. What frees us from sin and leads us to righteousness?
title: Righteousness

prayer: Spend time in prayer focusing on Jesus’ words in verse 29.
quoteContent: Anyone who truly walks with God, walks humbly. The closer we draw near to Him, the more we behold His Majesty!
thought:
Have you ever been weary or burdened? What did it feel like?

A yoke trains young oxen to plough by linking them to mature oxen. Why do you think Jesus used this metaphor?

How are the words of Jesus reassuring to his followers?
challenge: If you know someone who is stressed help ease their burdens this week.
title: Come to me

quoteContent: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light
challenge: Be obedient to parents, teachers and God – it may not be as easy as you think!
prayer: Pray you can be a light that points others to find God.
thought:
Have you ever experienced total darkness? What did it feel like?

‘Your word is a lamp for my feet’. What do you think verse 105 means?

The psalm mentions obeying God’s laws. What are they and how are you obedient?
title: Light the way

thought:
What does the reading say about how God knows you?

Which verses do you find comforting/challenging?

How does this passage inspire you to live as a Christian?
challenge: Do something this week that shows others that you are a Christian.
quoteContent: God not only loves me as I am, but also knows me as I am
prayer: Ask God to help you live totally for him.
title: You know me

challenge: When faced with a challenge this week ask God for wisdom.
thought:
What is wisdom? When have you experienced wisdom?

Solomon could have asked God for anything. Why do you think he asked for wisdom?

What is the difference between knowledge and wisdom?
quoteContent: God gives us people to love and things to use, not things to love and people to use
title: Wisdom
prayer: Ask God to help you to know the difference between right and wrong.
Ask God to bless you through the things you are wrestling with.
challenge: Write a journal expressing your struggles and blessings from God.
thought:
Have you been in a situation where you wrestled over what to do?

Who do you think Jacob was wrestling with?

Jacob was forever changed after this encounter with God. How has God changed you?
title: Wrestling with God
quoteContent: God sometimes takes us into troubled waters. Not to drown us but to cleanse us

challenge: Be courageous this week – step out in faith!
prayer: Thank God that when life gets scary, He is always in control.
quoteContent: If you want to walk on water, you have to get out of the boat
title: When focus is lost
thought:
Have you been on a boat? What was it like?

Do you think Peter was courageous or crazy to get out of the boat?

What can you learn about Jesus from this passage?

challenge: Find out about churches in your area. Visit their buildings or arrange a joint event.
thought:
How many different churches can you name? What makes them different?

What does Psalm 133 say about unity?

How can churches better live and work together?
prayer: Pray for Christians in other local churches.
title: Living in unity
quoteContent: Alone we can do so little. Together we can do so much

title: Be transformed
quoteContent: Every generation laughs at the old fashions, but follows religiously the new
thought:
Who are the top five people that influence you?

Read verse 2. How is this a challenge for Christians today?

What does it take to be a good influencer to others?
challenge: Consider this week what you are doing and why you are doing it?
prayer: Ask for God’s help fighting the influences that lead you away from Him.

quoteContent: Tread softly! All the earth is holy ground
title: Holy ground
challenge: Note down every moment when you feel God is speaking to you.
thought:
God called Moses from a bush. Can you list other examples of God speaking in the Bible?

Why did Moses’ mood change from fascination (v3) to frightened (v6)?

How do Christians know when God is speaking to them?
prayer: Pray God speaks to you through words, images, senses and emotions.
Ask God to help you love other as He loves you.
quoteContent: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into a friend
title: Law of love
challenge: Try this week to show love to someone in practical ways
thought:
What or who do you love most in the world?

What does the reading teach you about the importance of love?

What are the biggest challenges in loving your neighbour as yourself?

prayer: Pray God helps you forgive something you have found hard to forgive.
challenge: Start each day this week saying The Lord’s Prayer
title: Keep forgiving
quoteContent: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them
thought:
Is there anything that is unforgivable? Why?

Why does Jesus imply that you must forgive someone so many times?

What does the reading say about forgiveness and not forgiving?

challenge: Bake someone a cake or buy food for a local food bank or similar.
prayer: Pray about some of the things you’ve complained about recently.
quoteContent: You say to God, “I have never seen you provide for me.” God says to you, “You have never trusted me”
thought:
What have you complained about recently? Was it worth it?

The Israelites grumbled about food! How did they feel when they saw the quail and bread?

What is the difference between ‘wanting’ and ‘needing’? What do you need from God?
title: Bread of heaven

quoteContent: Humility is not thinking less of yourself, it's thinking of yourself less
title: Imitating Christ
challenge: Ask someone to support you in your quest to be more like Jesus!
thought:
When have you looked out for the interests of others?

What does the writer say about Jesus in these verses?

What could you do to imitate Christ more in your daily life?
prayer: Ask God to help you become more like Jesus every day.

title: Ultimate goal
prayer: Ask God to help you to press on to all he has for you.
thought:
How competitive are you? Do you always try to win?

What is the prize that Paul is talking about in his letter?

As Christians, what do you think the ultimate goal should be?
quoteContent: I don't focus on what I'm up against. I focus on my goals and I try to ignore the rest
challenge: Go for a walk and talk to God about your aspirations and goals.

quoteContent: I cannot believe in a God who wants to be praised all the time
prayer: Choose a phrase from the Psalm and use it as a prayer.
challenge: Rewrite Psalm 150 as your praise to God this week.
thought:
What do you think about the quote from Friedrich Nietzsche?

What does the psalm say about praising God?

List the different ways you can praise God.
title: Praise the Lord
Words and actions
challenge: Give an extra hour of your time this week to serve God.
thought:
A hypocrite says one thing but does another. Have you experienced this?
 
Why does Jesus call the religious leaders hypocrites?

How much of your life do you divide up between God and other stuff?
quoteContent: The important thing is not what they think of me, but what I think of them
prayer: Ask God to prompt you when your words do not match your actions.

quoteContent: God's love has no limits, it lasts forever
thought:
Which is easier – loving God or loving your neighbour?

Jesus also said, ‘love your enemies’. Are there examples when Jesus did this?

Who do you need to love first, yourself or your neighbour? Why?
prayer: Who do you struggle with? Pray God changes your attitude towards them.
title: God is number one
challenge: Read Deuteronomy 6: 5 and Leviticus 19: 18 – how do they link to today’s reading?

thought:
What makes a good parent, what sort of things do they do?
 
How does God the Father show his love to all his children?

How can you show others you are a child of God?
title: Children of God
challenge: Do something kind for someone who cares for you.
prayer: Pray for all parents, grandparents, carers and guardians.
quoteContent: Just because you are a child of God, that doesn’t mean you can act like a child

challenge: Read a different page of the Bible each day.
quoteContent: How do you know you have a servant’s heart? Look at your reaction when you are treated like one
prayer: Ask God to help you to serve Him more faithfully.
thought:
The reading focuses on serving God. What ways do you serve God?

What was Joshua’s warning to the people and how did they respond?

How can you give more of your time and energy to serving God?
title: Serving God

quoteContent: To whom much is entrusted, much is required
title: Use it wisely!
challenge: Make a card celebrating a friend’s talent/gift. Hide it where they might find it.
thought:
Have you been given something valuable to look after? How did it make you feel?

What is going on in this parable? Is it fair?

How can you responsibly use the talents/gifts God has given to you?
prayer: Ask God to reveal a new talent/gift within you.

challenge: Think about your actions towards others: are you willing to help the least and the lost?
quoteContent: You are always one defining decision away from a totally different life
thought:
Can you think of a time when you were in need and someone helped you?

Look up verses 40 and 45 – what does Jesus mean by this?

How do Jesus’ words challenge how you act?
prayer: Pray that your actions flow out of your relationship with Jesus.
title: Sheep and goats
